meanings.def: a number of people or animals moving in a line
examples: a camel train

meanings.def: a series of events or actions that are connected
examples: His death set in motion a train of events that led to the outbreak of war.

meanings.def: the part of a long formal dress that spreads out on the floor behind the person wearing it
to have something as a result
examples: Unemployment brings great difficulties in its train.
In the train of the rich and famous came the journalists.
That telephone call set in train a whole series of events.

meanings.def: the connected series of thoughts that are in your head at a particular time
examples: The phone ringing interrupted my train of thought.
I lose my train of thought when there are distractions.

meanings.def: to teach a person or an animal the skills for a particular job or activity; to be taught in this way
examples: train somebody/something highly trained professionals
badly trained staff
Specially trained coaches will provide support at no extra charge.
He is well trained to complete any mission that he is given.
train somebody/something to do something They train dogs to sniff out drugs.
The crew are well trained to deal with emergencies.
We trained our sales force to be sensitive to the needs of customers.
train somebody as/in/for something The students are being trained for careers in big business.
train as/in/for something He trained as a teacher before becoming an actor.
All members of the team have trained in first aid.
train to do/be something Sue is training to be a doctor.

meanings.def: to prepare yourself for a particular activity, especially a sport, by doing a lot of exercise; to prepare a person or an animal in this way
examples: I train in the gym for two hours a day.
She was unable to train with the squad.
train for something athletes training for the Olympics
train somebody/something She trains horses.
He trains the Olympic team.
train somebody/something for something The athletes will be trained for all events.
The team is training hard for the big match.
He's been training seriously for over a year now.

meanings.def: to develop a natural ability or quality so that it improves
examples: train something An expert with a trained eye will spot the difference immediately.
train something to do something You can train your mind to think positively.

meanings.def: to make a plant grow in a particular direction
examples: Roses had been trained around the door.

meanings.def: to aim a gun, camera, light, etc. at somebody/something
examples: He carefully trained his gun on the suspect.
